bamp 1.9.34

  • BAMP website

Bayesian Age-Period-Cohort Modelling

Volker Schmid

2018-07-11

bamp.Rmd

Data example

BAMP includes a data example.

data(apc)
plot(cases[,1],type="l",ylim=range(cases), ylab="cases", xlab="year", main="cases per age group")
for (i in 2:8)lines(cases[,i], col=i)

APC model with random walk first order prior

model1 <- bamp(cases, population, age="rw1", period="rw1", cohort="rw1",
              periods_per_agegroup = 5,  verbose=TRUE)
## AGE-PERIOD-COHORT Model.
## Prioris: age effect RW 1, period effect RW 1, cohort effect RW 1.
## 8 age groups, 10 periods, 45 cohorts. 
## 55000 iterations with 5000 burn in, using every 50th sample. Tuning at iteration 500
## Hyper parameters: age eff. (1, 5e-04) - period eff. (1, 5e-04) - cohort eff. (1, 5e-04).
## 
## verbose level: TRUE.
## 
##  Starting Iterations in 4 chains.
## 
## 
## Computing deviance and DIC.

bamp() automatically performs a check for MCMC convergence using Gelman and Rubin’s convergence diagnostic. We can manually check the convergence again:

checkConvergence(model1)
## [1] TRUE

Now we have a look at the model results. This includes estimates of smoothing parameters and deviance and DIC:

print(model1)
## 
##  Model:
## age (rw1)  - period (rw1)  - cohort (rw1) model
## Deviance:     231.29
## pD:            36.86
## DIC:          268.15
## 
## 
##  Hyper parameters:                 5%           50%          95%         
## age                              0.403        1.038        2.245
## period                          66.968      198.297      619.429
## cohort                          34.571       59.061       96.711

We can plot the main APC effects using point-wise quantiles:

plot(model1)

More quantiles are possible:

plot(model1, quantiles = c(0.025,0.1,0.5,0.9,0.975))

APC model with random walk first order prior

model2 <- bamp(cases, population, age="rw2", period="rw2", cohort="rw2",
              periods_per_agegroup = 5,  verbose=TRUE)
## AGE-PERIOD-COHORT Model.
## Prioris: age effect RW 2, period effect RW 2, cohort effect RW 2.
## 8 age groups, 10 periods, 45 cohorts. 
## 55000 iterations with 5000 burn in, using every 50th sample. Tuning at iteration 500
## Hyper parameters: age eff. (1, 5e-04) - period eff. (1, 5e-04) - cohort eff. (1, 5e-04).
## 
## verbose level: TRUE.
## 
##  Starting Iterations in 4 chains.
## 
## 
## Computing deviance and DIC.
checkConvergence(model2)
## Warning: MCMC chains did not converge!
## [1] FALSE
print(model2)
## 
##  Model:
## age (rw2)  - period (rw2)  - cohort (rw2) model
## Deviance:     246.00
## pD:            33.77
## DIC:          279.77
## 
## 
##  Hyper parameters:                 5%           50%          95%         
## age                              2.035        6.221       16.854
## period                          60.303      309.613     2726.984
## cohort                          35.357       74.064      142.431
plot(model2)

model3<-bamp(cases, population, age="rw1", period=" ", cohort="rw2",
              periods_per_agegroup = 5,  verbose=1)
## AGE-COHORT Model.
## Prioris: age effect RW 1 , no period effect, cohort effect RW 2.
## 8 age groups, 10 periods, 45 cohorts. 
## 55000 iterations with 5000 burn in, using every 50th sample. Tuning at iteration 500
## Hyper parameters: age eff. (1, 5e-04) - cohort eff. (1, 5e-04).
## 
## verbose level: 1.
## 
##  Starting Iterations in 4 chains.
## 
## 
## Computing deviance and DIC.
checkConvergence(model3)
## [1] TRUE
print(model3)
## 
##  Model:
## age (rw1) cohort (rw2) model
## Deviance:     276.57
## pD:            30.07
## DIC:          306.64
## 
## 
##  Hyper parameters:                 5%           50%          95%         
## age                              0.311        0.794        1.661
## cohort                          38.982       74.533      137.175
plot(model3)

(model4<-bamp(cases, population, age="rw1", period="rw1", cohort="rw1",
             cohort_covariate = cov_c, periods_per_agegroup = 5, 
             parallel = FALSE, verbose = 1, 
             mcmc.options=list("number_of_iterations"=50000)
             ))
## AGE-PERIOD-COHORT Model.
## Prioris: age effect RW 1, period effect RW 1, cohort effect RW 1.
## Cohort effect with covariates  starting at position 1
## 8 age groups, 10 periods, 45 cohorts. 
## 50000 iterations with 5000 burn in, using every 1th sample. Tuning at iteration 500
## Hyper parameters: age eff. (1, 5e-04) - period eff. (1, 5e-04) - cohort eff. (1, 5e-04).
## 
## verbose level: 1.
## 
##  Starting Iterations in 4 chains.
##

(model5<-bamp(cases, population, age="rw1", period="rw1", cohort="rw1",
             period_covariate = cov_p, periods_per_agegroup = 5, 
             parallel = FALSE, verbose = 1, 
             mcmc.options=list("number_of_iterations"=50000)
             ))
## AGE-PERIOD-COHORT Model.
## Prioris: age effect RW 1, period effect RW 1, cohort effect RW 1.
## Period effect with covariates  starting at position 1
## 8 age groups, 10 periods, 45 cohorts. 
## 50000 iterations with 5000 burn in, using every 1th sample. Tuning at iteration 500
## Hyper parameters: age eff. (1, 5e-04) - period eff. (1, 5e-04) - cohort eff. (1, 5e-04).
## 
## verbose level: 1.
## 
##  Starting Iterations in 4 chains.
##

plot(model5)
